item.title: Welcome to Peripatetic.me
item.author: corum@example.org (Jerry Corum)
item.description: So I decided to actually use this domain I’ve had for years for a website. My friend Damien told me about keeping a “TIL” journal, basically a searchable list of snippets of things I have learned that I think are interesting or might be useful in the future. So this is mostly for me, but if someone else can get some benefit from these random bits of knowledge that’s a bonus!

item.title: About Me
item.author: corum@example.org (Jerry Corum)
item.description:
Jerry Corum is a Specialist Solutions Architect for Red Hat, Inc. and is also a raging nerd. Jerry has worked in IT (or IT adjacent) since 1999, primarily within Windows Server environments, though has also branched out working with GIS technologies as well and even acted as a GIS data manager aboard an Arctic research vessel, the R/V Westward Wind.

Thanks for reading!
